keyTakeAways: US President Donald Trump has threatened to cut subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombia, citing concerns over drug trafficking and alleged failure to combat illegal narcotics production.
Colombian President Gustavo Petro has responded by calling Trump 'rude and ignorant,' rejecting the accusation of being a drug leader.
The feud has caused significant public anxiety in Colombia, with citizens fearing job losses, economic instability, and disrupted trade due to potential tariffs.
The United States is Colombia’s largest trading partner, accounting for 30% of Colombian exports; key exports include oil, coffee, flowers, gold, fruits, and manufactured goods.
A potential tariff increase could lead to bankruptcy of companies and loss of employment, especially in sectors dependent on US demand.
Colombian citizens are also concerned about visa access for family members living in the US, with some blaming Petro’s public criticism of Trump for escalating tensions.
The US has previously revoked Petro’s visa after he called for disobedience of Trump’s orders during a pro-Palestinian demonstration in New York.
Trump’s threat to cut off $450 million annually in aid for drug trafficking eradication efforts would severely impact Colombia’s anti-drug programs.
Colombians broadly criticize both leaders for their rhetoric, emphasizing that drug trafficking remains unresolved and that public discourse should not harm ordinary citizens.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The diplomatic feud between Colombian President Gustavo Petro and US President Donald Trump has intensified, with Trump accusing Petro of being a drug trafficker and threatening to cut US aid and raise tariffs on Colombian exports. This has sparked widespread concern among Colombians, who fear economic consequences such as job losses, business bankruptcies, and difficulties in obtaining visas for family members in the US. The US is Colombia’s largest trading partner and major provider of economic and military aid, including $450 million annually for drug eradication programs. Petro has responded by condemning Trump’s accusations as ignorant and disrespectful, while public figures across Colombia express frustration at both leaders’ rhetoric, emphasizing that the real issue—drug trafficking—remains unsolved and deeply affects everyday citizens.
title: Colombians caught in fallout of Trump-Petro feud
